definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Finally, the cohesion and coherence of discourse also have an impact on the translation of polysemic words.
sentences.chinese: 同時，語篇的銜接與連貫也作用於多義詞的翻譯。

sentences.english: A:Let me see. Oh, its polysemous word.
sentences.chinese: 我來看看，哦，這是個多義詞。

sentences.english: Paradox is a polysemy with several layers of concepts.
sentences.chinese: “悖論”是一個多義詞，表達着多個概念。
多義詞是語言中的普遍現象。

sentences.english: A new method of polysemant meaning disambiguation is provided.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一種機器翻譯中多義詞詞義排歧的新方法。

sentences.english: In addition, we process the polysemous problem using rough sets.
sentences.chinese: 本系統還利用模糊集來處理多義詞的問題。

sentences.english: Philosophical logic is a polysemant in contemporary logical literature.
sentences.chinese: 在現代邏輯文獻中，“哲學邏輯”是個多義詞。
